website_summaries.verdict: This mesh drum head is a great choice if you live in an apartment, dorm, or anywhere else where you need to worry about noise levels.
pros: Works well with external electronic triggers
Available in sizes from 6 to 24 inches
cons: Some say these heads feel too much like practice pads

customer_reviews.title: Great for playing quietly, but don't expect all volume to diminish
customer_reviews.text: As the title says, these heads are pretty great. They feel solid enough and allow bounce with the stick to mimic a standard drum head, but these won't dampen the sound totally, which is expressed in the description. Regardless, I have had these installed on my kit for a few years now, and play here and there, and have not had an issue with the snare or tom heads becoming damaged. The kick head, however, did end up tearing where the beaters hit.
customer_reviews.author: Kirby F.

customer_reviews.title: Silent without sacrificing feel
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my drum set to practice in a house with multiple people living in it and it works like a charm. I replaced the rubber muting pads I had that went on top of my regular drum heads with this because this product felt a lot more like a real drum head than the rubber. There's a lot of response and bounce. Not to mention it just looks better too. I don't wail on my drum heads when I play or practice, so I expect these to last a long time, but I will update if that is not the case.
customer_reviews.author: Methas

customer_reviews.title: A life saver for trigger sets
customer_reviews.text: I have spent so much time with acoustic heads and trigger systems converting my kit into an acoustic/electric hybrid. I now use my real acoustic cymbals and record them with mics. Everything else is all triggered, and getting the bass drum to not double trigger was a big problem. That was until I got this mesh head, it really helped negate a lot of the triggering issues I was having. Mesh heads are the way to go for converting a set 100%
customer_reviews.author: Steven DiLeo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Practicing!
customer_reviews.text: The Silent Stroke heads are amazing! They cut down the sound of your drums to a level that's acceptable to everyone in the house, and they feel great. The only "problem" is that if you want to hear your actual drums, you need to take the time to switch out the heads. These heads would be perfect either for someone who doesn't have the option of playing at full volume in his practice space, or for someone who has dedicated practice and gigging kits.
customer_reviews.author: fmnjr

customer_reviews.title: These heads will not fit the Remo practice pads
customer_reviews.text: They are meant to be mounted on your snare/tom/bass drums and do not fit the Remo practice pads of the same size. They are about half a cm too wide, just enough to block the lug holes on the practice pad. You have to get the mesh heads made specifically for the practice pads.
customer_reviews.author: David Y.

customer_reviews.title: Great Heads!
customer_reviews.text: After 13 years of weekly performing with the Hart Magnum 2 ply mesh heads on E converted acoustic kits, I was skeptical upon giving these Remo single ply mesh heads a run for their money. Mind you, I use Ahead aluminum sticks and perform arena rock music. I fitted my entire A/E kit with these along with a dual Remo Falam Slam patch on kick and single on snare as I have with any other mesh heads. Eight four hour performances later without a mark, tear or even a burr on any of them. Surprisingly durable for a single ply head and well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: U.P. Rocker

customer_reviews.title: Cuts Down Volume Substantially as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: The Silentstroke cuts down a lot of drum volume--maybe too much. I have to really whack the heads, I have it on four drums, and I'm not hearing any complaining from the neighbors. Its not the sound a drummer wants except for lowering the volume. I've seen claims that there is a 90% loss of volume. It was almost a shock when I first started playing them. Fortunately, I have kept the old heads. I'm learning so it's just as well.
customer_reviews.author: KRB

customer_reviews.title: Everything It’s Advertised To Be
customer_reviews.text: I recently outfitted my 7-piece acoustic DDRUM Kit with Silentstroke heads and trigger them. They’re durable and fit exactly as you would expect from any other drum head. Plus I live in a condo, so they positively MUST be quiet, and they are. But surprisingly they do have a great tonal quality to them even as quiet as they are. I’m very happy with these heads.
customer_reviews.author: J. P. Douglas

customer_reviews.title: If your into lift rebound, this is the product for you...
customer_reviews.text: Little can be said. It's a good well-made product and is just a whole lot of fun to use. Of course it doesn't sound like a real snare head, but the Fender Rhodes never did sound like a piano...and it was still great. If your into lift rebound, this is the product for you to get that Moehler rebound happening. My first delivery was damaged, but Amazon and the supplier were all over it to get me a perfect replacement. Very satisfied and having a hoot of a time with my "practice pad drum set." My wife is grateful also (lol).
customer_reviews.author: The SakDaddyTop Contributor: Drums

customer_reviews.title: Great for silent drumming. Has near identical bounce-back to plastic heads.
customer_reviews.text: Lives up to the "silent" name. It's great for apartment or close quarters drumming. Has the potential to be too quiet, however. If you still want some volume, I might suggest mute pads or tone control rings. This head has bounce back near identical to that of a real plastic drum head. I use this head for my snare and pearl mesh heads for my toms. There isn't a noticeable difference between the two, but the Pearl pack was slightly cheaper than the same pack from Remo. These aren't too much more expensive, but if you're penny-pinching, I might recommend saving a couple bucks with a Pearl mesh head.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: It only held up a few months to my heavier playing. I play on an e-kit w/ a converted acoustic snare. It triggered ok, but couldn't handle rolls too well (side-mounted piezo, not center). Other than that I managed to put a hold right in the center a few months later. For the occasional need of silencing an acoustic, I imagine this head is all you'd need, but if you're e-drumming, definitely get a 2 or 3-ply head from another company
customer_reviews.author: Robb

customer_reviews.title: Better than Expected Durability
customer_reviews.text: After 13 years of weekly performing with the Hart Magnum 2 ply mesh heads on E converted acoustic kits, I was skeptical upon giving these Remo single ply mesh heads a run for their money. Mind you, I use Ahead aluminum sticks and perform arena rock music. I fitted my entire A/E kit with these along with a dual Remo Falam Slam patch on kick and single on snare as I have with any other mesh heads. Eight four hour performances later without a mark, tear or even a burr on any of them. Surprisingly durable for a single ply head and well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: U.P. Rocker

customer_reviews.title: Surprising durability!
customer_reviews.text: After 13 years of weekly performing with the Hart Magnum 2 ply mesh heads on E converted acoustic kits, I was skeptical upon giving these Remo single ply mesh heads a run for their money. Mind you, I use Ahead aluminum sticks and perform arena rock music. I fitted my entire A/E kit with these along with a dual Remo Falam Slam patch on kick and single on snare as I have with any other mesh heads. Eight four hour performances later without a mark, tear or even a burr on any of them. Surprisingly durable for a single ply head and well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: U.P. Rocker

customer_reviews.title: Great for edrums
customer_reviews.text: Works great on my electric kit so far. I have it on an acoustic kick with a trigger perfect rim trigger and a beater pad. Before I out in the beater pad the trigger barely picked up but after the beater pad it triggers absolutly dead on.
customer_reviews.author: DARTH HAIR

customer_reviews.title: In peace with the peace!
customer_reviews.text: This a really nice way to play the drums and don’t disturb the family or the neighbors. The only thing I’m not satisfied with this head is the fact it’s too bounce and very different from a real head. I added some patches and it helped diminishing the rebound.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Bulhões

customer_reviews.title: Love 'em
customer_reviews.text: These are great for practicing quietly. Much more realistic feel than rubber pads. I have an electronic kit as well, but these can be put on your acoustic drums to more closely resemble the feel of the acoustic kit without bothering the neighbors or family. Work great with Zildjian's new low volume cymbals.
customer_reviews.author: Fudge13

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought along with an evans patch for double pedal. If you're going to play intense bass dependent genres it would be good to protect it with some kevlar patches. The other one I used without protection broke during an intense session, which could happen with any kind of head.
customer_reviews.author: Felipe

customer_reviews.title: Buy them
customer_reviews.text: My kids sleep next to me while I play these. The only sound is when you hit the rims. They do have more rebound than normal heads. But it’s a great alternative I love that these exist and so do my neighbors. They do not mic up. I haven’t tried triggers.
customer_reviews.author: G0T B00K'S

customer_reviews.title: INFERIOR PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: I HAD two of these. Tore right through both of them on a single stroke on the very first song. What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Super quiet
customer_reviews.text: I love this drum head. I can play confidently, now, without having to worry about bothering others
customer_reviews.author: seth hayes

customer_reviews.title: so cool
customer_reviews.text: these heads are awesome! feel natural and i use them with the roland RT30 triggers for a hybrid kit and its a much better alternative to small rubber or mesh pads.
customer_reviews.author: Austin P.Top Contributor: Drums

customer_reviews.title: Love it when stuff works!
customer_reviews.text: The silent stroke does as advertised. I can now play my drums again and not disturb anyone in the house or wake the baby. The tone is a little different, but that is to be expected. I can't speak for the durability as these have only been on the drumset for a few days, however drum head durability can vary drummer to drummer so I am not concerned. The point is that these heads are QUIET!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Mize

customer_reviews.title: Love 'em
customer_reviews.text: These are great for practicing quietly. Much more realistic feel than rubber pads. I have an electronic kit as well, but these can be put on your acoustic drums to more closely resemble the feel of the acoustic kit without bothering the neighbors or family. Work great with Zildjian's new low volume cymbals.
customer_reviews.author: Fudge13

customer_reviews.title: Love 'em
customer_reviews.text: These are great for practicing quietly. Much more realistic feel than rubber pads. I have an electronic kit as well, but these can be put on your acoustic drums to more closely resemble the feel of the acoustic kit without bothering the neighbors or family. Work great with Zildjian's new low volume cymbals.
customer_reviews.author: Fudge13

customer_reviews.title: Great for Toms - Terrible for Snare Drums
customer_reviews.text: These are very effective at lowering the volume, but I would only recommend putting these on toms. On a snare drum, they sound terrible. I finally put my normal batter head back on and replaced it with the Aquarian Super Pad, which is much nicer. But on toms, these rock.
customer_reviews.author: Abersteve

customer_reviews.title: Silent drum heads
customer_reviews.text: I can practice anytime without disturbing the whole family and repetitive practice doesn't drive people to want to kill me so thats a good thing
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: I am happy with the response they provide
customer_reviews.text: Installed on my Hart Dynamics Drum, as hart no longer makes heads. Tad transparent but thats ok. I am happy with the response they provide. I will see how their durability works out in the coming months. For now I would say they are a good value from a good maker.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great practice heads
customer_reviews.text: Excellent practice drumheads. I plopped an old t shirt into the drum and put on the head. It takes a little fiddling, but once you get your desired tension, it's awesome. With a shirt or rag in the drum, it's pretty much silent. Awesome!
customer_reviews.author: SEA2012

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Working perfectly on my Roland V-Concert Drums, at one third the price of the Roland replacement heads.
customer_reviews.author: David S Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Works really well!
customer_reviews.text: I just got this Remo 22in kick silentstroke drum head! I put it on right away to see how low the volume really is, and I'm blown away! I love it it reduced the sound of my kick drum the way I wanted it to! I wanted to practice at low volumes on my actual drum kit, and now I can! Buy it! I love it so will u! There are also Remo silentstroke drum heads for the snare and the toms.
customer_reviews.author: Stan Vasilchuk

customer_reviews.title: These are my favorite mesh heads
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite mesh heads. I think these feel more natural than the ones remo makes for roland, better than pearl, and better than pintech. That being said, these are mesh drumheads so they still feel weird. Pretty quiet - obviously there is still some noise but compared to mylar its silent.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Great Natural Feel. Great for triggering.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Feels very natural. I’ve played on many different mesh heads from 1 2 and 3 ply options from around the world. This is the best bass head for triggering my diy e kit
customer_reviews.author: Samuel J. Einsohn

customer_reviews.title: As Described - Excellent
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for silent heads or converting to an edrum set up, these are key. They work very well.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Love 'em
customer_reviews.text: These are great for practicing quietly. Much more realistic feel than rubber pads. I have an electronic kit as well, but these can be put on your acoustic drums to more closely resemble the feel of the acoustic kit without bothering the neighbors or family. Work great with Zildjian's new low volume cymbals.
customer_reviews.author: Fudge13

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my new Alesis DM10x. These are excellent heads. Very tough and well worth the money. Remo has always made a quality product and their mesh heads are no exception. Very quiet and very tough and super rebound. They are single ply so you can see through them. Don't hesitate do it up! :)
customer_reviews.author: Leandra

customer_reviews.title: Very good drum head
customer_reviews.text: These are great mesh heads for the price. They are only one ply and tend to be a bit bouncy but works great with my hybrid e kit.
customer_reviews.author: William T Bryan

customer_reviews.title: The silent stroke does as advertised. I can now ...
customer_reviews.text: The silent stroke does as advertised. I can now play my drums again and not disturb anyone in the house or wake the baby. The tone is a little different, but that is to be expected. I can't speak for the durability as these have only been on the drumset for a few days, however drum head durability can vary drummer to drummer so I am not concerned. The point is that these heads are QUIET!

customer_reviews.title: so cool
customer_reviews.text: these heads are awesome! feel natural and i use them with the roland RT30 triggers for a hybrid kit and its a much better alternative to small rubber or mesh pads.
customer_reviews.author: Austin P.Top Contributor: Drums

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: A really great product!..considerably lowers overall volume but warm snare sound remains.
customer_reviews.author: Brian P. Dalton

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised
customer_reviews.text: I was planning to spend more on a double or triple ply drum head for an A to E conversion project, but went with SilentStrokes because of the cost and reputation. I have loved playing them and have been pleased with the feel and playability.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Love it when stuff works!
customer_reviews.text: The silent stroke does as advertised. I can now play my drums again and not disturb anyone in the house or wake the baby. The tone is a little different, but that is to be expected. I can't speak for the durability as these have only been on the drumset for a few days, however drum head durability can vary drummer to drummer so I am not concerned. The point is that these heads are QUIET!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Mize

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: fantastic on my electric kit. I've bought multiple so far and always recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Very good for decreasing sound but keeping the feel of real ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good for decreasing sound but keeping the feel of real drums. They produce about a third of the volume of regular heads. Great for kids or for practice.
customer_reviews.author: momof2boys

customer_reviews.title: Remo great product.
customer_reviews.text: It’s hard to tell how durable these are? I have not had very long. Remo makes a great product, I did purchase a pearl silent head and its. Color is black which looks cool mounted. Plays the same so that could be another option.
customer_reviews.author: Frank S

customer_reviews.title: I trust Remo!
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a single layer mesh head and these fit the bill just fine, so far. Pretty quiet and a good price. They are a touch spongy but that's just the nature of the item. We'll see how durable they are in time but I trust the Remo brand. They've been around for many, many years.
customer_reviews.author: Fredline

customer_reviews.title: The silent stroke does as advertised. I can now ...
customer_reviews.text: The silent stroke does as advertised. I can now play my drums again and not disturb anyone in the house or wake the baby. The tone is a little different, but that is to be expected. I can't speak for the durability as these have only been on the drumset for a few days, however drum head durability can vary drummer to drummer so I am not concerned. The point is that these heads are QUIET!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Mize

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This drum head is awesome! Perfect for our 2 1/2 year old son since he likes to play his drums morning or night. The packaging was open when we got it and the box was smashed, but other than that great product.
customer_reviews.author: Tori Zumwalt

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my new Alesis DM10x. These are excellent heads. Very tough and well worth the money. Remo has always made a quality product and their mesh heads are no exception. Very quiet and very tough. They are single ply so you can see through them. Don't hesitate do it up! :)
customer_reviews.author: Leandra

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement head for my Roland PD-85
customer_reviews.text: Good replacement head for my Roland PD-85. Single mesh, not dual like original but that was clearly marked and works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Stoliker

customer_reviews.title: ... price for these heads relative to other brands is pretty good. I dislike the annoying metallic buzzing sound ...
customer_reviews.text: The price for these heads relative to other brands is pretty good. I dislike the annoying metallic buzzing sound they make, but it can be fixed with a remo muffle ring. This is the only brand I've ever tried, so I have no reference for comparison.
customer_reviews.author: Adam C. Stoddard

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for apartment drumming
customer_reviews.text: This amazing material allows you to slug away without making noise. Just loud enough for your ears. Fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: C. A. Hardey

customer_reviews.title: Do it.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. You can barely hear it, and I beat the crap out of my heads. 10/10, would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Gillespie

customer_reviews.title: Responds kinda like a marching snare with very little sound
customer_reviews.text: Responds kinda like a marching snare with very little sound. Great for practicing and not disturbing anyone in the next room.
customer_reviews.author: Cekebo

customer_reviews.title: They do what they say they do.
customer_reviews.text: These heads are a wonder. They really do the reduce the volume by 80-90%. My only critical comment is that these heads feel somewhat more springy than a regular drum head. That said, playing on them is far superior to and much more "real" than playing on a drum with a rubber mute (I tried the Evans Sound Off Mutes first).
customer_reviews.author: Alan L. Pasternack

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I don’t mind the bounce and I love that it’s quiet
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Manno

customer_reviews.title: Truly perfect for apartment living
customer_reviews.text: I can play rudiments on my 12" snare while watching TV or carrying on a conversation in my apartment without bothering anybody. Youhear just a slight bump with no real volume at all. Bought a 14" for my other snare for the heck of it.
customer_reviews.author: kanine2112

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent drum head, i am using it on my Roland V-drums. Great price, great product.
customer_reviews.author: Jecster

customer_reviews.title: Simple. Brilliant.
customer_reviews.text: Just completely rad to be able to play the kit in the middle of the living room without worrying about being that obnoxious neighbor. Life changer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: this is not a drum head
customer_reviews.text: i thought i was getting a mesh drum shaped like a head--how cool would that be? surprise my eyes. i should have read the fine print.
customer_reviews.author: baby crab cakes

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: These heads are really all they're cracked up to be. Nice feel and tonal quality at a fraction of the dB level. Amazing for practicing in the house. No kidding, I have my drum set on the 1st floor and can play while my 2 yo sleeps up on the 3rd floor.
customer_reviews.author: Sam B.

customer_reviews.title: Really, almost completely silent
customer_reviews.text: I'm surprised at how little sound this makes. Works great as a practice head in small apartments.
customer_reviews.author: AmaZone

customer_reviews.title: Great for silent practice and creating E-drums!
customer_reviews.text: I play Evans heads, but they do not make these. These are great for silent practice! They are also great for creating a trigger out of an acoustic drum! C'mon Evans, get on board!
customer_reviews.author: GlobalBen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfect for a mesh head conversion on my alesis DM8.
customer_reviews.author: Dan D

customer_reviews.title: just as good as Roland head but less cost.. buy it
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful better price and just as good as original roland. but cheap price...
customer_reviews.author: chris234

customer_reviews.title: Great head for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is basically just a single layer version of the Roland head. It has a little tighter response than the Roland head, but of course it's done after you break through.
customer_reviews.author: LR DR

customer_reviews.title: Great head for a great price
customer_reviews.text: This is the best mesh head I have used by far. Before I tried this, I was using Pearl Muffle heads. One would break just about every week. This one is a beast. I can't break it.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Does what i need it to ... KEEP THE VOLUME DOWN. And strong
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Throw in some Zildjian low-volume cymbals, and you've got yourself a winner.
customer_reviews.author: ahleika

customer_reviews.title: Got this as a back up, the one I ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a back up, the one I have is starting to wear out, tested it and it works and sounds great
customer_reviews.author: choggan360

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This drumhead is great if your triggering the drum. Or practice.
customer_reviews.author: Awill1615

customer_reviews.title: and durability has been fine so far
customer_reviews.text: Bought a set of these two or three months ago for my electronic drumset. They are much quieter than the Mylar heads that came stock. I play often (though not very hard), and durability has been fine so far. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Quality manufactured
customer_reviews.text: Still loving the silent stroke head mounted on the electronic drum shells. Remo will always be a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: S. M. Cook

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I'm am really satisfied with this drum head, the sound is reduced and they are extremely durable, but it!
customer_reviews.author: Stan Vasilchuk

customer_reviews.title: Everybody's happy
customer_reviews.text: These are great. My son plays them without holding back, and they are still super quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: i received this 13in Remo silentstroke today and I love it! I wanted to play my drums at lower volumes and now I can. Buy it! Ull love it!
customer_reviews.author: Stan Vasilchuk

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I am really satisfied with this drumhead! Sound is reduced and it is extremely durable, buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Stan Vasilchuk

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my DIY electronic tom-tom.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my DIY electronic tom-tom. Much quieter than electronic pads.
customer_reviews.author: Keith R.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my DIY electronic tom-tom.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my DIY electronic tom-tom. Much quieter than electronic pads.
customer_reviews.author: Keith R.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my DIY electronic tom-tom.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my DIY electronic tom-tom. Much quieter than electronic pads.
customer_reviews.author: Keith R.

customer_reviews.title: Great heads!
customer_reviews.text: These are really nice heads that do a great job at "quieting down" your kit so you can freely practice without offending anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Wingrider68

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just what is needed when you need to practice at night while everyone else is sleeping!
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Great for practicing and for any low volume situation
customer_reviews.text: These heads are great for practicing, they are quiet and have a great feel. The only problem is that they don't allow you to use brushes, the wires get stuck on them.
customer_reviews.author: oswaldo

customer_reviews.title: not bad but not good either
customer_reviews.text: I got this drum head to figure out if i can trigger my vst through a drum trigger. It's hard trying to find out how much tension to put and if it is a good head to put triggers on. Turns out it is only 1 ply where as better mesh heads are 2 or 3 ply for my purposes. I think this is just supposed to be a just turn your loud set into a quiet practice set. Unusable in live setting.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Better than Pearl. Actually have some good snare sound, better then pad playing.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Product cuts out every few seconds. Does not deliver consistent signal. Want to return
customer_reviews.author: Chris Myers

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: For years I have not been able to practice on my drum set because of the noise. I bought a set of these heads for each of my drums, and it has made such an incredible difference in my ability to practice at all hours of the day. It should be noted that I also took the resonant heads off of some of the drums, and this also decreases the volume. I highly recommend this product. Very cool.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Jet

customer_reviews.title: Love 'em
customer_reviews.text: These are great for practicing quietly. Much more realistic feel than rubber pads. I have an electronic kit as well, but these can be put on your acoustic drums to more closely resemble the feel of the acoustic kit without bothering the neighbors or family. Work great with Zildjian's new low volume cymbals.
customer_reviews.author: Fudge13

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: As always Remo never lets you down. It is perfect
customer_reviews.author: Slade Eiland

customer_reviews.title: Great heads for quieting your toms.
customer_reviews.text: These are great for toms. The resonant head still gives a great tone, and these really quiet the batter head sound. They're a great match for the new Zildjian low volume cymbals. Just don't use the Silentstroke on your snare. You will be sorely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Abersteve

customer_reviews.title: prefer over the pearl mesh head
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these and 2 of the pearl mesh heads and prefer these. They have a better and more realistic feel in my opinion. Only time will tell on how good they wear...
customer_reviews.author: josh

customer_reviews.title: Bad choice
customer_reviews.text: This product is not good enougth. My son play everyday about 30 to 50 min, after a little more of a month some are already broken. The best choice for play with minimun noise is using cymbals low volume.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No sound
customer_reviews.text: It's silent alright. Guess I wasn't expecting it to make NO sound. I know, what part of "silent" didn't I get? Impossible for me to practice without hearing anything, but maybe that is perfect for someone else, or use triggers.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Like mylar better
customer_reviews.text: I tried turning my mylar drum into mesh with this head, It did not work at all, it is so thin you can see through it, I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Tippett

customer_reviews.title: NOT
customer_reviews.text: I tried turning my mylar drum into mesh with this head, It did not work at all, it is so thin you can see through it, I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Tippett

customer_reviews.title: Only if you have mesh heads already
customer_reviews.text: I tried turning my mylar drum into mesh with this head, It did not work at all, it is so thin you can see through it, I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Tippett

customer_reviews.title: Makes playing much quieter
customer_reviews.text: I like the quality of the construction and that you can actually hit the Silentsroke head hard and very minimal sound is heard.
customer_reviews.author: LH

customer_reviews.title: the silentstroke heads are freakin awesome! put a set of these on with some ...
customer_reviews.text: I use the on 2 hybrid sets with Ddrum hot shots. the silentstroke heads are freakin awesome! put a set of these on with some L80 cymbals and you can play all night!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Stewart

product_meta.title: Remo Silentstroke Bass Drumhead, 22"
product_meta.description: Size:22"| Style:Silentstroke BassThe Ambassador Silentstroke drumheads are the ultimate in low volume drumheads, designed for quiet practice applications where standard drumset volumes are an issue. Constructed with 1-ply mesh material, Ambassador Silentstroke drumheads provide a soft spring-like feel at very low decibel levels. Available is sizes 6" - 24".
feature_bullets: The ultimate in low volume drumheads
Ideal for apartments, condos and dormitories
Works well with external electronic triggers
